question: Which Cricket World Cup was known as the "Benson & Hedges World Cup"?
explanation: The 1992 Cricket World Cup was known as the "Benson & Hedges World Cup". The 1992 Cricket World Cup (officially the Benson & Hedges World Cup 1992) was the fifth staging of the Cricket World Cup, organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was held in Australia and New Zealand from 22 February to 25 March 1992 and finished with Pakistan beating England by 22 runs in the final to become the World Cup champions for the first time.
